Wiki Formatting
=======
### ZeroWiki supports basic markdown tags, below is a collection of helpful tags to help visitors create articles with style.

---

Paragraphs are separated
by a blank line.

Two spaces at the end of a line leave a  
line break.

---

Horizontal Lines  like this can be done with \***, \--- and \___

---

An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

        An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
        A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

An internal link like [[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].  

        An internal link like ​[​[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].
​
---

This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
[id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here"
[style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here"

        This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
        [id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here" 
        [style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here" 
​

---

![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")  

        ![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")
​

---

This Is A Heading
===  
        This Is A Heading
        ===

This Is A Sub-heading
----  
       This Is A Sub-heading
       ----
 
# This Is H1  
        # This Is H1  
 ## This Is H2  
        ## This Is H2  
### This Is H3  
        ### This Is H3  
#### This Is H4  
        #### This Is H4  
​

---

Text attributes:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.................... |......................|  
| _italic_  | \_Italic_  |  
|.................... |......................| 
| **bold**  | \*\*Bold**  |  
|.................... |......................|  
| `monospace` | \`Monospace` |  
|.................... |......................|  
​

---

   ### How to make a list:  
   notice the two spaces before *pears* and *oranges*. They will make it a sub-list.  

```
Numbered list:  

  1. apples
  2. oranges
    * pears  
  3. banana
```
```
 Bullet list:

  * apples 
    1. oranges
  * pears
  * banana
```

Numbered list:  
1. apples
2. oranges
  * pears  
3. banana

Bullet list:  
  * apples     
    1. oranges
  * banana                   
  * pears                       
​
---
### To make a code snippet:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ---------------------------- |:----------------------------:|  
|.................................................. |....................................................|  
| ``` The code you want to see ```  |     \`\`\` The code you want to see \`\`\`   
​

---
### Making a table:  
```
| Markdown           | Normal             |  
| ------------------ |:------------------:|  
|................... |....................|  
|* markymark *       | ​nonormal           |  
```  
| Markdown           | Normal                    |  
| ----------------------- |:-----------------------:|  
|....................... |.........................|  
| ** markymark **         | ​nonormal               |  
​

---
### Escaping a markdown character:  
As an escape char you can use "\" before the char you want to escape. This will make it read as a normal character and not hold any special meaning. Good if you want to write a \* for instance.

| Markdown           | Normal          
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.............................. |................................|  
| \*literal asterisks\*  | ​\\\* literal asterisks​\​*  |  
​

---
Further reading can be done at [GitHub's Markdown-Cheatsheet](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet)
​

# Criticism of ZeroNet

To inform you that ZeroNet is not perfect, but a proof-of-concept.

1. Lack of modularity, and collaboration, compared to IPFS. 
2. No DHT feature, only a workaround by tracker exchange, which is more centralized.
3. Single point of failure, in multiple ways
    - ZeroName system, relying on a single vps run by nofish, and the workarounds, like NameYo, are not sufficient.
    - Development of Zeronet. Imagine nofish is hacked. In the field of blockchain, this problem has been solved.
    - ZeroID. The whole zeronet relys on it heavily, other IDs are mostly non-unique. Non-unique IDs are very vulnerable to spamming.
      As far I know, there's a bot written by a zeronet developer which is successful in registering a lot of zeroids. If he were willing to attack zeronet, he could easily flood it on any site using zeroid. Blacklist wouldn't work in this situation. 
4. Poor performance
    - Using sqlite, which requires syncing the database each time you get/publish new data, and rebuilding it if your database was corrupted unluckily. The whole thing can be done gracefully like Orbit-db or GUN. 
    @ssdifnskdjfnsdjk
    
    I think that no skilled zeronet developers ever wanted to run zeronet proxy. If they try it on a single or dual CPU thread system and really host at least 20 sites including larger ones like Millchan and its optional files, then they would discover zeronet is useless, super slow, lagging. https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/2312
I am running proxy for some time. Tried several Linux OS, py2, py3, maximize disk and other threads in /Config but the result is nearly unusable ZN instance - page loading from half a minute to several minutes.
5. Data duplication
    - You may think duplication makes it harder to detect pirating. This is ridiculous, as you lose efficiency on data transport and you get nothing on anonymity.
6. Other weird designs
    - Now in ZeroNet API, there's a RSA encryption item, but one day, a new encyption method called XYZ is invented, and nofish keeps adding new APIs. This is just an example, and this indicates why designing a good dweb framework is hard.

@blurhy

I think he has already realized that the project is outdated and stopped adding new features, but only maintains it.
The whole design of the project was not carefully thought over in the first place.
It is simply a rewrite of Freenet. If there had been IPFS, he would have started ZeroNet based on IPFS.
IPFS is founded in 2015, and this requires a team, at least there're multiple tech leaders. It's too hard for someone to code the complete protocol stack alone, or he's genius.
I wrote this wiki, for you who blindly believe ZeroNet is perfect, being lazy to explore anything other than ZeroNet.

I couldn't even find a criticism page on this, so this page is fairy necessary.

## Critism on search engines

Each year, there're always some search engines being created for ZeroNet, and some are discontinued.

What's the reason behind the phenomenon ?

The so-called 'search engines' are actually indexes, which require a single point, the owner, to maintain it continually.
As I point out above, there're some weird and careless designs, making it difficult to improve the performance.

@blurhy

I gave up Horizon search after realizing the fundamental flaws of Zeronet.
Probably, other developers would also face the same problems and stop their projects.

## Criticism on PoW proposal

@blurhy

PoW is not only a waste of energy, but also non-sense to FPGA. Spammers always have more power to win the energy wasting competition, just like how several laregest miners dominate bitcoin, causing it centralized.

One obvious example is, mobile phones can't afford PoW, so that it's centralized. PoW itself can centralize the network, without blockchain.

Welcome to ZeroWiki

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform that has been built for the [[ZeroNet]] network.  This wiki is a public, decentralized, and [[cloning|clonable]] site that can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, and sharing knowledge through the creation of [[FAQ]]s, Tutorials, and other documentations. 

You can view the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works, or practice some of your [[zerowikiformat| formatting]] skills on the Wiki's [[sandbox]] page.

### Getting Started:
- [[zeronet|What is ZeroNet?]]
- [[zite|What is a "Zite"?]]
- [[mute|Muting a user]] 

#### ZeroNet Websites (zites):
- [[zearch| List of Search Engines]] 
- [[List of Zites]]

#### Zeronet Information:
- [[hubs|List of ZeroMe Hubs]]
- [[proxies|List of proxies, allowing you to view ZeroNet from clearnet]]

- [[zerome|What is ZeroMe?]]

- [[sandbox|Sandbox, you can play with it before editing other pages]]

#### Programming/Development:
- [[devresources|List of resources for ZeroNet and Zite development]]
- [[criticism|Criticism of ZeroNet]]

#### Misc:
- [[wallofshame|The Copyright Wall of Shame Community Edition]]
- [[copytrollquotes|A Collection of Quotes by Copyright Trolls]]

#### Useful wikis:
 - [New ZeroWiki](/1LX2wiouHctuUXtu5WkVM9TJJ3YoL6gAfm/) - Clone of ZeroWiki
 - [ZeroTuto, learning resources and tutorials related to ZeroNet](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/)

## Site Templates

1. [[ZeroTemplate]]

     ZeroTemplate is a template for creating and developing ZeroNet sites. It provides an easy way to develop advanced ZeroNet sites with NPM dependencies and automatic building and releasing.

2.  [Kopi](/1KtzUsnmwc1Wr7KWWEGnWzmBSQoyH917Pz) 

    Kopi is a ZeroNet boilerplate with all the necessary elements to start a new project without the need to configure and develop the same features again and again.

3. [ZeroNetTemplate](https://github.com/anoadragon453/ZeroNetTemplate)

   Site template for making ZeroNet sites with modern web technologies.

4. [Zeronet/React example site](https://github.com/rllola/zeronet-react)

    Get started creating a ZeroNet site using React. Need to be updated.

5. [Zeronet in the Eyes of the Media/Timeline example site](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NEwsvyrAoEWU64ZozwdfgEUQhwxiCrh1t)

## Dev Tools

1. [[ZeroFrameJS|ZeroFrame WebSocket API for JavaScript]]

    This is JavaScript WebSocket client for ZeroFrame API. It supports (almost) same features as default ZeroFrame that is included in ZeroNet sites, but it is using WebSocket client so it can be used in local programs, such as Node.js and Electron. It can't be used in browsers because of CORS restrictions.

1. [[ZeroFramePy|ZeroFrame WebSocket API for Python]]

    This is Python WebSocket client for ZeroFrame API. It supports (almost) same features as default ZeroFrame that is included in ZeroNet sites, but it is using WebSocket client so it can be used in local programs.

2.  [ZeroDevLib](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroDevLib)

    Libraries for ZeroNet site development.

3. [Zeroframe on NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/zeroframe)

4.  [ZeroFrame Router](/1K2myjtjoEVpRC2JMieRL73ES4V4iLP2Ev/?/) #vue.js

    A very basic router that works with the ZeroFrame API.

5. [Mavo](/1F6Rt2QNMA6uJTSTZkDNBfXTd3unrtgcdJ/) #official #experimental

     ZeroNet storage plugin for Mavo that allows any web application created for this platform to run in a P2P and decentralized way without any modification. [[ref]](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:113:ZeroNet+backed+for+Mavo)

6.  [zeronet-websocket](/1JKPBG3dLp9FARyarPoR3Mv3p5d9Fy9Em1)

    Nodejs websocket wrapper for ZeroFrame API

7.  [ZeroNet-cmd-lib](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroNet-cmd-lib)

    Python websocket wrapper for ZeroFrame API, command-line tools for ZeroNet and some ZeroNet sites.

## Dev Services

1. [Git Center](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/)

    Git Center is a decentralized hosting platform for Git repositories. Provides several collaboration features such as bug tracking for every project, and private and public repositories.

2. [0git](/0git.bit/)

   Git repositories hosted on ZeroNet.

3. [Git over ZeroNet](/1xxooZ7s8iDz3u56i5mNQ1XGmwF8Zvnw9/)

4. [Static git repository page generator](/stagit.0git.bit/)

5.  [CodeR](/1CodEr7T9xNXSPcwbsvf5fHTqsixDMwDzL/)

    JSFiddle and CodePen alternative.

6. [NullPaste](/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/) 

    PasteBin alternative.

7.  [ZeroDB](/ZeroDB.bit/)

    Visual editor to create Dbschema files.

Welcome to ZeroWiki

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform that has been built for the [[ZeroNet]] network.  This wiki is a public, decentralized, and [[cloning|clonable]] site that can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, and sharing knowledge through the creation of [[FAQ]]s, Tutorials, and other documentations. 

You can view the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works, or practice some of your [[zerowikiformat| formatting]] skills on the Wiki's [[sandbox]] page.

Dev Ideas
=======

- [proof of concept js application](/1AtRr9BPxKkPswG4uKn17bht2JCdv2cMqt/)

## Zite Concepts
- [Diaspora](https://diasporafoundation.org/) Alternative with Multi Platform Support.
- LEGAL Music Zite with a payment system similar to [Brave Payments](https://brave.com/faq-payments/#what-is-brave-payments)
- "Facebook"-like in development 
- Profession/Business-oriented social networking zite (LinkdIn-like)
- "CMS" admin panel for ZeroBlog
- Music voting platform (similar to defunct PromoBay) Something that would allow zites to place a 'Jam-of-the-week / month' on their frontpage.
- Username carryover token file key export (to allow ease username / id preservation during migration)
- Mobile App Market
- Sort favorite sites into categories on ZeroHello front page
- A more traditional style forum engine akin to phpbb and vBulletin. (Threads are grouped into subforums, no likes/upvotes, BBCode instead of Markdown, etc.)
- A more customizable blog engine
- Option to only serve content from a zite to tor users for more mandatory user anonymity.
- Web of Trust system to facilitate content curation/filtering, search and marketplace trust
- Newsletters (GrowSurf-like)
- Comments (Disqus-like)
- Social gadgets (Profile/Like/Share-button, for ZeroMe/Peeper)
- Books (Wattpad-like, can be based on Zerobook with social features like ZeroMedium haves)
- Scholarly article database (Google Scholar/JSTOR-like)
- Podcasting and Music platform dedicated to original content (suggestion by @krixano here)
- Good and Up to date News zites that aren't just mirrors of clearnet stuff (suggestion by @krixano here)
- Goodreads and Review zites (suggestion by @krixano here)
- Cryptocurrency assisted by Git (using commits as blocks in blockchain)
- Plugin that helps every peer help to crawl URLs for search engines
- Plugin for multiple site owners (using BTCADDRESS+BTCADDRESS or hash in the URL)
- eBazar bridge with plugin
- Zite listing actors, movies, series, TV shows, youtubers (IMDB-like)
- Music Lyrics/Cifras
- News aggregator (Google Newsstand-like)
- Translator, using open-source translator codes, converting C code using Emscripten, every language used as merger sites
- Feedback service, can be integrated with zites (Uservoice-like)
-  .exe downloads zite
-  Android .apk downloads zite
- Game ROM/ISO and PC abandonware download zite (CoolROM, EmuParadise, The ISO Zone-like)
- Pokemon fansite
- Calendar zite (integrated with ZeroMe's events)
- Contacts zite (integrated with ZeroMe)
- Zite to draw and post art/design images (Deviantart-like)
- Zite to create musics (Beatlab-like)
- Zite to create simple static webpages from markdown similar to [txti](http://txti.es/).
- Peertube compatible bridge (Peertube 1.0 is out)
- Script to convert WordPress blogs into ZeroBlogs

## Dev Tools

1. [[ZeroFrameJS|ZeroFrame WebSocket API for JavaScript]]

    This is JavaScript WebSocket client for ZeroFrame API. It supports (almost) same features as default ZeroFrame that is included in ZeroNet sites, but it is using WebSocket client so it can be used in local programs, such as Node.js and Electron. It can't be used in browsers because of CORS restrictions.

1. [[ZeroFramePy|ZeroFrame WebSocket API for Python]]

    This is Python WebSocket client for ZeroFrame API. It supports (almost) same features as default ZeroFrame that is included in ZeroNet sites, but it is using WebSocket client so it can be used in local programs.

2.  [ZeroDevLib](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroDevLib)

    Libraries for ZeroNet site development.

3. [Zeroframe on NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/zeroframe)

4.  [ZeroFrame Router](/1K2myjtjoEVpRC2JMieRL73ES4V4iLP2Ev/?/) #vue.js

    A very basic router that works with the ZeroFrame API.

5. [Mavo](/1F6Rt2QNMA6uJTSTZkDNBfXTd3unrtgcdJ/) #official #experimental

     ZeroNet storage plugin for Mavo that allows any web application created for this platform to run in a P2P and decentralized way without any modification. [[ref]](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:113:ZeroNet+backed+for+Mavo)

6.  [zeronet-websocket](/1JKPBG3dLp9FARyarPoR3Mv3p5d9Fy9Em1)

    Nodejs websocket wrapper for ZeroFrame API

7.  [ZeroNet-cmd-lib](https://github.com/imachug/ZeroNet-cmd-lib)

    Python websocket wrapper for ZeroFrame API, command-line tools for ZeroNet and some ZeroNet sites.

# Horizon

[Link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HoRiznsHbJAqs2bmrVcSd79NTGVFp4Ju2/)

Horizon is a new search engine implementation for ZeroNet.

The site was authored by developer [[blurhy]].

## Required Environment

- Zeronet Rev > 3582

## The Principle

Horizon's data is compiled from its spider software, [HorizonSpider](https://github.com/blurHY/HorizonSpider). The spider works by crawling zeronet pages, then compiling the data it finds into a MySQL database. This data is then exported to JSON, and when the site is started for the first time the JSON is converted back into an efficiently queryable database using [[ZeroNet]]'s built in SQLite functionality.

Searches are then conducted by searching this database via ZeroNet's [[ZeroFrame]] API.

### Search Speed

Comments from blurhy (Sep 25,2018):

I need to find a balance between slow database building and slow query. Also the data is very huge. Maybe Horizon's database is the biggest. I'm improving it now.

### Further Thoughts

Comments from blurhy (Sep 25,2018):

Horizon isn't the final solution to the search problem of zeronet. You would see a lot of result because of it has huge data. If you download the 1.5TB whole zeronet, you will get more result. That spider just crawls keywords and a few phrases. So you can't get any result if you search a sentence.

So the final problem is **How to search in non-downloaded zites**

- Search in other peers' databases. [Github issue](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1602)
- [Distributed search](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1544353154_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK/Distributed+search+plugin)

Horizon is a little slow.That's beacause zeronet's Full-text search feature hasn't been implemented.
But zeronet is moving to python3 now.

## Data

The data Horizon uses is crawled in Aug 2018.

## Links

[HorizonTalk](/1KkHNyD9TA5bi4gwGDYuTKSWp94MQEqrS1) - A talk for Horizon

## Abandonment

Simply indexes are far not enough to enlarge the network. A better way is required for the next-gen dweb.

zearch unlike on the normal web where website are hosted in a central server and "search" since its decentralized and served by peers the terminology used is zearch

I need to find a balance between slow database building and slow query. Also the data is very huge. Maybe Horizon's database is the biggest. I'm improving it now.

### Further Thoughts

Comments from blurhy (Sep 25,2018):

Horizon isn't the final solution to the search problem of zeronet. You would see a lot of result because of it has huge data. If you download the 1.5TB whole zeronet, you will get more result. That spider just crawls keywords and a few phrases. So you can't get any result if you search a sentence.

So the final problem is **How to search in non-downloaded zites**

- Search in other peers databases. [Github issue](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1602)

# Horizon

[Link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HoRiznsHbJAqs2bmrVcSd79NTGVFp4Ju2/)

Horizon is a new search engine implementation for ZeroNet.

The site was authored by developer [[blurhy]].

## Required Environment

- Zeronet Rev > 3582

## The Principle

Horizon's data is compiled from its spider software, [HorizonSpider](https://github.com/blurHY/HorizonSpider). The spider works by crawling zeronet pages, then compiling the data it finds into a MySQL database. This data is then exported to JSON, and when the site is started for the first time the JSON is converted back into an efficiently queryable database using [[ZeroNet]]'s built in SQLite functionality.

Searches are then conducted by searching this database via ZeroNet's [[ZeroFrame]] API.

# Welcome to ZeroNet

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[Bittorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public, [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.
